subject: Re: [junit] fundamental questions on JUnit
msgSnippet: I can see the value of Junit for testing functions but how can you, if a procedure is updating a database, are you going to have test functions that query the
messageBody:
I can see the value of Junit for testing functions but
how can you, if a procedure is updating a database,
are you going to have test functions that query the db
to read back the results? this would seem impractical
in general. Of course, if you say that redesigning the
procedures into functions is game, then all is well.

the basic question for me in the discussion is:

2) <b> How can you verify the execution path that a
program is taking unless its output returned is unique
for that path? </b>


--- Mike Clark <mike@...> wrote:
> juwo77 wrote:
>
> >
> > 1) JUnit seems to test "functions" that return a
> value. How will you
> > test "procedures" that do work instead?
>
> Test the side-effect of the work. This may involve
> querying an instance
> variable or passing in a mock object somewhere to
> collect the results of the
> work. The latter is sometimes useful to avoid
> breaking encapsulation.
